column2: Commissioner of Income Tax, Trinidad & Tobago is relevant for the
determination of the general rule of deduction, prohibition of deduction
and the special rule of deduction. However, the Appellant has failed
to  identify  the  nature  of  the  expenses  claimed  by  the  Appellant  as
“outgoings”  in  its  statement  of  accounts  and  include  them  in  the
accounts separately as required by section 106(11) of the IRA 2006;
